sentence.Network_en: Keep your spending on luxuries down to manageable proportions.
sentence.Network_cn: 将你在奢侈品上的花费降至可控范围。

sentence.Network_en: In the tropics plants grow to huge proportions.
sentence.Network_cn: 在热带，植物会长得非常高大。

sentence.Network_en: a financial crisis of mammoth proportions

entry.def: A proportion of a group or an amount is a part of it.

example.ex: A large proportion of the dolphins in that area will eventually die...
example.tran: 那片区域里的很大一部分海豚终将死去。

example.ex: A proportion of the rent is met by the city council.
example.tran: 一部分租金由市政委员会支付。

entry.def: The proportion of one kind of person or thing in a group is the number of people or things of that kind compared to the total number of people or things in the group.

example.ex: The proportion of women in the profession had risen to 17.3%...
example.tran: 从事该职业的女性比例已升高到17.3%。

example.ex: The radio station has to include a substantial proportion of classical music.
example.tran: 该电台不得不播放大量的古典音乐。

entry.def: The proportion of one amount to another is the relationship between the two amounts in terms of how much there is of each thing.

example.ex: Women's bodies tend to have a higher proportion of fat to water.
example.tran: 女性的身体内脂肪与水分的比例往往更高。

entry.tran: （通常指极其巨大的事物的）大小，尺寸
entry.def: If you refer to the proportions of something, you are referring to its size, usually when this is extremely large.

example.ex: In the tropics plants grow to huge proportions.
example.tran: 在热带，植物会长得非常高大。

entry.tran: （艺术品或设计的各部分之间的）比例
entry.def: If you refer to the proportions in a work of art or design, you are referring to the relative sizes of its different parts.

example.ex: You can vary the relative proportions of things in a picture very simply.
example.tran: 你能很简单地改变一幅画中事物的相对比例。

entry.def: If one thing increases or decreases in proportion to another thing, it increases or decreases to the same degree as that thing.

example.ex: The pressure in the cylinders would go up  in proportion to the boiler pressure.
example.tran: 汽缸内的压力会随着汽锅压力的增加而相应增加。

entry.def: If something is small or large in proportion to something else, it is small or large when compared with that thing.

example.ex: Children tend to have relatively larger heads than adults in proportion to the rest of their body.
example.tran: 与成人相比，儿童头部占整个身体的比例相对较大。

entry.tran: 与…极不成比例；与…完全不相称
entry.def: If you say that something is out of all proportion to something else, you think that it is far greater or more serious than it should be.

example.ex: The punishment was out of all proportion to the crime.

entry.def: If you get something out of proportion, you think it is more important or worrying than it really is. If you keep something in proportion, you have a realistic view of how important it is.

example.ex: Everything just got blown out of proportion...
example.tran: 所有一切都变得不可收拾了。

example.ex: We've got to keep this in proportion.
example.tran: 我们应当正确对待这一点。

entry.tran: 区别轻重缓急的能力；分寸感；主次观念
entry.def: If someone has a sense of proportion, they know what is really important and what is not.

example.ex: We must not lose our sense of proportion.
example.tran: 我们不能丧失主次观念。

auth_sentence.content: This would have been a battle of epic proportions.
auth_sentence.res_content: This would have been a battle of epic proportions.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This would have been a battle of epic proportions.

auth_sentence.content: Look, this is a moment of historic proportions.
auth_sentence.res_content: Look, this is a moment of historic proportions.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Look, this is a moment of historic proportions.

auth_sentence.content: By the nineteen-nineties, obesity reached epidemic proportions.
auth_sentence.res_content: By the nineteen-nineties, obesity reached epidemic proportions.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: By the nineteen-nineties, obesity reached epidemic proportions.
